intro: Astronia cumingiana var. cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's astronia, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understory habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
